IPL 2025 points table after MI vs SRH clash, orange and purple cap leaderboard
IPL 2025 points table after MI vs SRH clash, orange and purple cap leaderboard
With Mumbai Indians registering an emphatic win against Sunrisers Hyderabad, defeating the side by four wickets at the Wankhede Stadium, let us have a look at the updated points table, alongside orange and purple cap lists after the game.
Mumbai Indians defeated Sunrisers Hyderabad by four wickets.
Image Source : AP
Edited By:
Akshit Bhatnagar
@Akshit2104
Published:
April 17, 2025 23:53 IST
, Updated:
April 17, 2025 23:53 IST
New Delhi:
Game 33 of the ongoing
IPL
(Indian Premier League) 2025 saw Mumbai Indians taking on Sunrisers Hyderabad. Both sides locked horns at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai on April 17, and the clash saw MI coming in to bowl first after winning the toss.
Led by
Hardik Pandya
, the five-time champions were excellent with the ball, as they were quite economical, not letting the SRH batters get the ball onto the bat. For the visitors, Abhishek Sharma and
Heinrich Klaasen
were the top performers with the bat, scoring 40 and 37 runs, respectively. In the first innings, SRH managed to post a total of 162 runs.
Aiming to chase down the target, Mumbai Indians got off to a quickfire start as
Rohit Sharma
amassed 26 runs in 16 deliveries, with Ryan Rickelton adding 31 runs in 23 balls. Furthermore, Will Jacks and Suryakumar Yadav scored 36 and 26 runs, respectively, as MI chased down the target comfortably, winning the game by four wickets.
Updated points table after MI vs SRH clash:
After the win for Mumbai Indians, the side is sitting in 7th place in the standings after the win. The side has won three matches and lost four in the seven that they have played. On the other hand, Sunrisers Hyderabad occupy ninth place in the standings with two wins and five losses in seven matches.

There was no changes in the top three of the IPL orange cap standings. Nicholas Pooran still sits at the top, with Sai Sudharsan and Mitchell Marsh in second and third place.
Purple cap list
Chennai Super Kings' Noor Ahmad is on top of the purple cap leaderboard list. He has 12 wickets to his name.
Kuldeep Yadav
and Hardik Pandya are in second place with 11 wickets to their name, with Prasidh Krishna in third with 10 wickets.

Yesterdays Ipl Match Result Who Won Yesterday Mi Vs Srh Ipl 2025
Yesterday’s IPL Match Result: Who Won Yesterday MI vs SRH IPL 2025?
Jatin
MI defeated SRH in yesterday's IPL match [Source: @iplt20.com]
In a rather one-sided affair at the Wankhede Stadium, Mumbai Indians and Sunrisers Hyderabad squared off in Match 33 of IPL 2025. From explosive cameos to economical spells, the clash had something for everyone.
Abhishek Sharma’s elegant strokeplay and Klaasen’s late charge gave SRH a competitive total, but MI’s reply saw fireworks from Will Jacks, Rohit Sharma and SKY lighting up the night.
Result Of Yesterday’s IPL Match
Mumbai Indians defeated Sunrisers Hyderabad by 4 wickets
in Match 33 of IPL 2025.
Yesterday's IPL Match Score
Sunrisers Hyderabad: 162/5 in 20 overs
Abhishek Sharma 40 (28), Heinrich Klaasen 37 (28)
Will Jacks: 3-0-14-2, Jasprit Bumrah: 4-0-21-1
Mumbai Indians: 166/6 in 18.1 overs
Will Jacks 36 (26), Ryan Rickelton 31 (23)
Pat Cummins: 4-0-26-3, Eshan Malinga: 4-0-36-2
Yesterday’s IPL Man Of The Match
Will Jacks
Will Jacks
stood out with a game-changing all-round performance, first with the ball (2/14 in 3 overs), then with a breezy 36 off 26 balls to stabilize MI’s chase.
Yesterday’s IPL Match Most Runs
Abhishek Sharma: 40 (28)
SRH’s left-hander gave his side a flying start, finding gaps with ease and setting the tone in the powerplay.
Yesterday’s IPL Match Most Wickets
Pat Cummins: 3 wickets for 26 runs
The SRH skipper led from the front with the ball, removing key MI batters and applying pressure throughout his spell.
Yesterday’s Most Sixes
Rohit Sharma: 3 sixes
Rohit Sharma showcased his power-hitting as he smashed three sixes and became
the first batter to hit 100 IPL sixes at the Wankhede Stadium.

Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) vs Punjab Kings (PBKS)
